field.label: Enable
field.help: Enable the usage of DNS blocklists.

field.label: Type of DNSBL
field.help: Select which kind of DNSBL you want to use.

field.label: DNSBL Response Type
field.help: Select the desired DNSBL response type for blocklist matches. See 'local-zone' in unbound.conf(5) for full details. "Always" types always return the indicated response. "Inform" types generate additional logging that can be used to monitor blocklist matches. "Redirect" types will return NXDOMAIN if no local records are configured. Certain types support returning static records of the default response. (See the Null Response option). Types that match subdomains can improve DNSBL coverage but may require whitelisting some subdomains.

field.label: DNSBL Null Response
field.help: Return static null A/AAAA responses for supported response types. Null response records may result in decreased performance and/or battery life for some devices or apps.

field.label: URLs of Blocklists
field.help: List of domains from where blocklist will be downloaded.

field.label: Whitelist Domains
field.help: List of domains to whitelist. You can use regular expressions.

field.label: Private Domains
field.help: List of domains to mark as private. You only need this for some DNSBL lists which resolve to private addresses.

field.label: Insecure Domains
field.help: List of domains to mark as insecure. DNSSEC chain of trust is ignored towards the domain name.
